result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen M. Woodford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (>$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 22CM380 and 22CM348 dismissed and read in. Zero days of credit if revoked. If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: All stayed pending further order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen M. Woodford

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Ordered in the amount of $789.97
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge

ADDRESS INFO for Stephen M. Woodford
Current: 323 Seymour Road #17, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States  (Effective: 07-29-2022)
Prior: 1612 11th St, Eau Claire, WI 54703

(Cases 22CF385, 22CM330, 22CM348 are called at 3:10 PM) Defendant Stephen Woodford appears in person with Attorney Kerry Kelm. ADA Andrew Gunderson appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant quashed. Defense indicates there is an agreement and recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF385 Count 1- Felony Retail Theft. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including 22CM330, 22CM348. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 2 years Probation with the following conditions: 90 days jail, all stayed pending further order of the court; AODA and follow through with recommendations; Restitution in the amount of $789.97 plus 10% surcharge; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. 
Court orders no credit if revoked. State in compliance with victim notification requirements.

(Cases 22CF385, 22CM330, 22CM348 are called at 3:01 PM) Defendant Stephen M. Woodford not in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Stephen M. Woodford.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
No information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance- Defense has not received a return call from the Defendant. State requests warrant. 
Warrant ordered.

(Cases 22CF385, 22CM330, 22CM348 are called at 11:02 AM) Defendant Stephen M. Woodford not in court or by Zoom.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Stephen M. Woodford.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
No information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. Defense indicates she thought there was an agreement and an intended plea hearing today- has good contact with Defendant. 
Arraignment in 22CF385 and Status Conference in 22CM330, 22CM348: 7/29/2022 at 3:00 PM. (set for 15 minutes)

(1:33 PM cases 22CM330, 22CM348, 22CF385 called.) Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Stephen M. Woodford in court. Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Stephen M. Woodford.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF385 and Court accepts waiver. 
Attorney Kelm to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 2 Judicial Assistant, and the misdemeanor files will ride along.

10:11am Cases called: 22CF385, 22CM330 & 22CM348.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stephen M. Woodford in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Stephen M. Woodford. 

22CM330 & 22CM348: Waives reading of the complaint. Bond is set.

22CF385: Defendant would like a Preliminary Hearing.  22CM330 & 22CM348 will ride along.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
